entry.title: OpenStack's Bug Management
entry.content: This post intends to give you enough background to play an active part in working with bugs in OpenStack. This includes an understanding of the basic life cycle a bug goes through and in which state you can contribute in which way. It also clarifies some possible misunderstandings and gives a few best practices. In general, the bugs of a project (like Nova, Cinder, Neutron and others) can be found in our issue tracker Launchpad. The lists of bugs are available at https://bugs.launchpad.net/<projectname> for example https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova for the Nova project.
